fr.xephi.authme.listener

Class OnJoinVerifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.xephi.authme.listener.OnJoinVerifier
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Reloadable

    public class OnJoinVerifier
extends Object
implements Reloadable
    Service for performing various verifications when a player joins.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkAntibot(JoiningPlayer joiningPlayer, boolean isAuthAvailable)
      Checks if Antibot is enabled.
      void checkIsValidName(String name)
      Checks that the name adheres to the configured username restrictions.
      void checkKickNonRegistered(boolean isAuthAvailable)
      Checks whether non-registered players should be kicked, and if so, whether the player should be kicked.
      void checkNameCasing(String connectingName, PlayerAuth auth)
      Checks that the casing in the username corresponds to the one in the database, if so configured.
      void checkPlayerCountry(JoiningPlayer joiningPlayer, String address, boolean isAuthAvailable)
      Checks that the player's country is admitted.
      void checkSingleSession(String name)
      Checks if a player with the same name (case-insensitive) is already playing and refuses the connection if so configured.
      boolean refusePlayerForFullServer(org.bukkit.event.player.PlayerLoginEvent event)
      Handles the case of a full server and verifies if the user's connection should really be refused by adjusting the event object accordingly.

      Performs the reload action.

      • checkAntibot

        public void checkAntibot(JoiningPlayer joiningPlayer,
                         boolean isAuthAvailable)
                  throws FailedVerificationException
        Checks if Antibot is enabled.
        Parameters:
        joiningPlayer - the joining player to check
        isAuthAvailable - whether or not the player is registered
        Throws:
        FailedVerificationException - if the verification fails

        Parameters:
        isAuthAvailable - whether or not the player is registered
        Throws:
        FailedVerificationException - if the verification fails

      • checkIsValidName

        public void checkIsValidName(String name)
                      throws FailedVerificationException
        Checks that the name adheres to the configured username restrictions.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to verify
        Throws:
        FailedVerificationException - if the verification fails

      • refusePlayerForFullServer

        public boolean refusePlayerForFullServer(org.bukkit.event.player.PlayerLoginEvent event)
        Handles the case of a full server and verifies if the user's connection should really be refused by adjusting the event object accordingly. Attempts to kick a non-VIP player to make room if the joining player is a VIP.
        Parameters:
        event - the login event to verify
        Returns:
        true if the player's connection should be refused (i.e. the event does not need to be processed further), false if the player is not refused

      • checkNameCasing

        public void checkNameCasing(String connectingName,
                            PlayerAuth auth)
                     throws FailedVerificationException
        Checks that the casing in the username corresponds to the one in the database, if so configured.
        Parameters:
        connectingName - the player name to verify
        auth - the auth object associated with the player
        Throws:
        FailedVerificationException - if the verification fails

      • checkPlayerCountry

        public void checkPlayerCountry(JoiningPlayer joiningPlayer,
                               String address,
                               boolean isAuthAvailable)
                        throws FailedVerificationException
        Checks that the player's country is admitted.
        Parameters:
        joiningPlayer - the joining player to verify
        address - the player address
        isAuthAvailable - whether or not the user is registered
        Throws:
        FailedVerificationException - if the verification fails

      • checkSingleSession

        public void checkSingleSession(String name)
                        throws FailedVerificationException
        Checks if a player with the same name (case-insensitive) is already playing and refuses the connection if so configured.
        Parameters:
        name - the player name to check
        Throws:
        FailedVerificationException - if the verification fails
